parsed.internal_thinking: The board analysis shows several high-yield nodes. Node 43 has the highest total pip count at 13, but it's exclusively Wheat (Hexes 18, 15, and 14). Node 20 and Node 42 both have 12 pips. Node 20 provides a balanced mix of Wood (11), Brick (6), and Sheep (8), which is ideal for early-game expansion and road building. Node 42 provides Wheat (9, 9) and Ore (5), which is better for late-game cities but might stall early growth. Given this is the first settlement, securing Wood and Brick on high-probability numbers (6 and 8) is a strong strategy. Therefore, I will place my settlement on Node 20, which offers a 12-pip yield and essential starting resources. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Claimed Node 20 (Wood 11, Brick 6, Sheep 8). My next priority for the second settlement should be securing Wheat and Ore, ideally at Node 42 or 43, to balance my economy for the mid-to-late game.
parsed.say_outloud: Starting off with a strong position on the 6-Brick and 8-Sheep. Good luck everyone!
